newsitem.title: USA: L.A. cop charged with unlawful sex with Internet girl.
newsitem.headline: L.A. cop charged with unlawful sex with Internet girl.

text.p: A lieutenant in the internal affairs investigation department of the Los Angeles police pleaded not guilty Thursday to unlawfully having sex with a 17-year-old girl he met on the Internet.
Steve Twohy, 43, allegedly had intercourse with the girl, who lived with her mother, five times between November and February.
The relationship apparently began after they "met" in a computer "chat room," prosecutors said.
At his arraignment, the 19-year veteran of the Los Angeles Police Department, was granted bail of $10,000 and is on suspension pending the case. A preliminary hearing was set for Aug. 21.
His lawyer told reporters Twohy's defence would be that he believed the girl was over 18 years old.
Besides the unlawful sex charges, Twohy is also charged with illegal use of a police computer. He faces up to six years in prison if convicted.
